comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: George Washington Kendall (b. 29 Dec. 1881 in Montreal; d. 19 Oct. 1921 in Montreal) renamed himself George Kendall. He was a wrestler and sports promoter. Also the manager of the Canadiens Hockey club. "On 24 May 1913 Kendall staged a sports event that would stand for years as the most important of its kind in the history of Montreal: the fight between Stanislaus Zbysko of Poland and Constant Le Marin of Belgium for the world heavyweight championship. More than 10,000 people watched the match. That year he set up two American circuits, one in the east and one in the west." (ref. www.biographi.ca/009004-119.01-e.php?&id_nbr=7823 )
